As technology evolves, so do the tactics of scammers. In 2023, over $1.2 trillion was lost to scams, signaling a critical need for heightened awareness. This article unveils the likeliest scams in 2024, from disaster relief to AI-powered schemes, offering insights to help you navigate the evolving landscape of online security. Stay informed and safeguard your digital experiences from potential threats. Read on to find out the most likeliest of Scams you can encounter in 2024. Read More ScamAdviser in Your Browser Never get scammed (again) with the power of ScamAdviser in your browser with our free extension that informs you in real time whether a website is likely to be legitimate or a scam. The browser add-on is available for Google Chrome and Microsoft Edge, and you can install it on as many devices as you want including those of your family and friends to ensure that everyone is protected. Click the link below to download the free ScamAdviser Browser Extension. Download Now Complete Review Company Evaluation Cloudflare is a Content Delivery Network (CDN) platform. The platform provides only web performance and security, and not web hosting services. Cloudflare also partners with IBM Cloud and Google Cloud Platform, which means that the three organizations have many shared renowned clients. One of Cloudflare's most well-known offerings is its Domain Name Service (DNS), which incorporates security safeguards including a Web Application Firewall and a DDoS-blocker. Many trustworthy companies and platforms, including ScamAdviser, use the platform because of its established reputation; nevertheless, like everything else on the internet, scammers can still abuse it. Webshop Evaluation In our Analysis we always check the Tranco ranking. In this case it was low. A low Tranco ranking means that the website has relatively few visitors. For a new website this is logical. The same is true for a highly specialized website. However if the website claims to be a large corporate or popular site, than warning flags should be raised. How to recognize a scam Technical Evaluation We found a valid SSL Certificate. An SSL certificate is used to secure communication between your computer and the website. There are different levels of SSL certification. A free one is also available and this one is used by online scammers. Still, not having an SSL certificate is worse than having one, especially if you have to enter your contact details. The Mother of All Scams: Watch Out for These Scams on Mother's Day read more Popular Stories How to Recognize a Scam Website As the influence of the internet rises, so does the prevalence of online scams. There are fraudsters making all kinds of claims to trap victims online - from fake investment opportunities to online stores - and the internet allows them to operate from any part of the world with anonymity. The ability to spot online scams is an important skill to have as the virtual world is increasingly becoming a part of every facet of our lives. The below tips will help you identify the signs which can indicate that a website could be a scam.

thought: The extract from Scamadviser mentions some concerning points: the website has a low number of visitors, it has been registered recently, and there are no consumer reviews available. Although it has a valid SSL certificate, the lack of reviews and the recent registration are indicators that align with characteristics of scam websites. To make a more informed decision, I should also check the website's DNS records and search for any discussions about the site on social platforms.

The DNS records show an HINFO record with "RFC8482", which doesn't provide much information. This could be due to the DNS privacy measures in place, but it doesn't give us any additional insight into the legitimacy of the website.

There are no posts on Reddit discussing homekoehndesign.com, which means there is no community feedback available on the platform. This lack of discussion could either be because the site is very new or because it has not caught the attention of Reddit users. Given the information gathered so far, the lack of online presence and community feedback, recent domain registration, and no transparency in WHOIS data, there are several red flags associated with this website. Even though there are no concrete reports of scam activities, these indicators are enough to suggest a high risk of it being a scam. I now know the final answer. Based on the observations, it is likely that https://www.homekoehndesign.com/ is a scam website.
